visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing the proportional macronutrient composition of egg yolk using categorized nutritional percentages from peer-reviewed research
visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains one categorical variable (nutrient type) and one quantitative variable (percentage composition). Data originates from a peer-reviewed nutritional study published by MDPI, ensuring scientific validity through experimental measurement rather than synthetic generation. Values sum to 100% (±0.05% rounding tolerance), maintaining proportional integrity required for pie chart visualization.

The pie chart effectively communicates parts-to-whole relationships per Tufte's principles, using direct data labeling to maximize data-ink ratio. Color differentiation follows Cairo's perceptual discriminability guidelines for categorical data. The exploded 'Fat' slice draws attention to the second-largest component while maintaining proportional accuracy. Percentage formatting (D3-style .1f precision) enhances precision perception without decimal overload.
